title: DHL express Has charged disbursement fee + igst on top of regular custom charges on my $40 watch
selftext:
I ordered a wrist watch of $40. It was cleared by customs yesterday and today I got an invoice from DHL. Can someone help me explain me how these charges are calculated? Can I disagree to pay any of these especially the disbursement fee. Here is a snippet of the invoice. Kindly guide me what needs to be done as the delivery is due tomorrow.
The express Cargo clearance bill doesn't have this disbursement fee+igst.
Please suggest how I should tackle this?
comments: If you don't want to pay those changes you should have ordered it via IndiaPost. Any shipper will charge you a disbursement fee since they clear out all the customs paperwork for you and trust me you don't want to do that.
It’s the service fee for handling clearance process and documentation on your behalf. It’s pretty standard. 1000 bucks is absolutely worth it.

Importing goods is such a bitch in our country.
It's crazy that you have to pay more than the cost of the item itself.
In the US import duties are applicable only if the item value is over 500$
